# Government Tender Announcement
## Addictions Work Certificate Courses
### Request for Statement of Capabilities

 Correctional Services Canada (CSC) is seeking a contractor to deliver the Addictions Work Certificate Program to offenders at the Grand Valley Institution for Women.

#### Program Overview
The program will consist of six (6) courses, as mutually agreed upon, from the provided list. The contractor must deliver the courses, evaluate coursework, and report results at their place of business. The program will be delivered through offline remote learning with weekly monitored instructor assistance.

#### Contractor Requirements
*    The contractor must have a minimum of 3 years of experience in the past 5 years in delivering offline remote learning courses with instructor assistance.
*    The contractor's courses must be approved for study credit by the Canadian Addiction Counsellors Certification Federation (CACCF).
*    The instructor must be certified by the CACCF.

#### Contract Details
*    The proposed contract is for a period of 1 (one) year, from May 22, 2023, to May 21, 2024, with an option to extend the contract for 4 additional one-year periods.
*    The estimated value of the contract, including option(s), is $191,250.00.

#### Procurement Strategy
This procurement is not subject to any set-asides for Indigenous Suppliers. The procedural requirements of other international trade agreements will be fulfilled following compliance with the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

The closing date and time for accepting statements of capabilities is May 17, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST.

#### Notice of Exclusion
This notice is subject to the exceptions under the Trade Agreement Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA) article Kbis-09, Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) article 513, and Canada Korea Free-Trade Agreement (CKFTA) article XIII. The reason for the exclusion is the absence of competition for technical reasons.
